epic.basic

Class BasicSIR

  • java.lang.Object
    • epic.basic.BasicSIR

  • public class BasicSIR
extends Object
    class implementing basic SIR stochastic model (but not an individual based model) this is called from BasicSIRAmountManager
    Version:
    9 April 2014
    Author:
    Samantha Lycett

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicSIR(int N, double[] rates)
      constructor for BasicSIR model, initialised with total population size = N, and S->I,I->R reaction rates

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<BasicEventWithRate> generateEvents()
      returns S to I, and I to R events with rates call this after perform event and use to add to transition kernel
      String getDelim()
      returns the delimiter used in the modelStateString and modelStateHeader; the default is comma (,)
      int getN()
      returns the total population size as defined at initialisation (does not check the S+I+R=N)
      int getNumberI()
      returns the number of infecteds (in state 1)
      int getNumberInState(String stateName)
      returns number in the named state, or -1 if state not found
      int getNumberR()
      returns the number of recovereds (in state 2)
      int getNumberS()
      returns the number of susceptibles (in state 0)
      void initialiseWithInfected(int numI)
      initialised the number with the number of infected (numI), usually this = 1
      String modelStateHeader()
      returns the header i.e.
      String modelStateString()
      returns the model state as a string, suitable for writing to a csv file: numberS,numberI,numberR
      void performEvent(broadwick.stochastic.SimulationEvent reaction, int times)
      performs the event (reaction), a replicate number of times (times) here this will be either the S->I event, or the I->R event
      void setN(int N)
      set the total population size for this SIR model
      void setRates(double[] rates)
      set the reaction rates for S->I and I->R, this should be a double array with 2 elements, but it is not checked.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setN

        public void setN(int N)
        set the total population size for this SIR model
        Parameters:
        N -

      • setRates

        public void setRates(double[] rates)
        set the reaction rates for S->I and I->R, this should be a double array with 2 elements, but it is not checked. Note that the S->I rate is divided by N in the calculation, so you do not need to scale this on input
        Parameters:
        rates -

      • initialiseWithInfected

        public void initialiseWithInfected(int numI)
        initialised the number with the number of infected (numI), usually this = 1
        Parameters:
        numI -

        Parameters:

        times -

      • generateEvents

        public List<BasicEventWithRate> generateEvents()
        returns S to I, and I to R events with rates call this after perform event and use to add to transition kernel
        Returns:
        list of events to be added to the transition kernel for the next step

      • modelStateHeader

        public String modelStateHeader()
        returns the header i.e. column names for the model state as a string, suitable for writing to an csv file: S,I,R
        Returns:
        column names for the model state
